flawed_nl_solution:
If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34
Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=56>>56 years old.
Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.
Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+56 = <<74+56=130>>130 years
#### 130

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 54, not 56. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
